main event: A faint, hazy light, about half the size of the moon, was observed moving rapidly, reflecting off clouds and flickering.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on 6 September 1957 at 1937 hrs,The object was observed using ground-radar and air-intercept radar,The length of observation was approximately 2 minutes,The faint light appeared distant and caused flickering effects,The report does not contain any photographs despite mentioning them.
sighted object: a faint, hazy light in the sky
